content: for the underarm 34 36 38 sts on needles divide evenly and mark the center of underarm for end of round working in rounds continue in garter st knit 1 row purl 1 row this time as we are working circular until sleeve measures 6 6 5 7 15 16 5 18 cm or desired length from underarm optional for the cinched cuff only as blue jacket decrease 4 6 8 sts evenly over last row cast off firmly as we want this to cinch in a bit repeat with second sleeve finishing just weave in your loose yarn ends and add button - simply elegant timeless classics vintage appeal & heirloom quality garter stitch baby jacket top down - no sew - knitting for profit friendly some sewing method straight needle sleeves alternate no double point needles method **if knitting sleeves on straight needles only put body sts on holder and work each sleeve separately cast on 2 2 3 sts at beginning of the first 2 row continue in garter st until sleeve measures 6 6 5 7 15 16 5 18 cm or to desired length and sew seam knit body sts as above except pick up the underarm sts that you cast on when for the sleeve instead of casting on new stretchy cast off step 1 sts for the body underarm stretchy cast off 1 knit 1 2 knit 1 2 sts on right needle 3 slip both sts back to the left needle 4 knit them together through back of the loops repeat steps 2-4 to end once you get used to this you can combine steps 3 & 4 into one movement step 2 step 3 step 4a step 4b simply elegant timeless classics vintage appeal & heirloom quality garter stitch baby jacket top down - no sew - knitting for profit friendly designer bio hi i m nancy elizabeth munroe i work out of our century farmhouse in prince edward the county a small island community on the canadian shore of lake ontario my primary goal is to share my passion for maintaining excellence quality beauty and joy in the process and practice of fiber art i want to honor the human skills involved keep them from becoming a dying art and acknowledge the rich heritage the diversity and multicultural history of handcrafted textiles i try to stay mindful when sourcing my materials thoughtfully choosing sustainable natural and renewable resources this line of patterns are my semi-retirement project i ve developed them in response to your requests my goal is a design that you will enjoy knitting a design that will look terrific now and for years and even generations and a design that will always be in fashion i have wanted to write out my designs as patterns for a very long time and i m pretty excited that the time has finally come i have worked hard to make this pattern as comprehensive as possible while still remaining simple and
